"Hockey Stick Broken! ‚ÄúScientist‚Äù Michael Mann Loses in Court, Forced to Pay Court Costs ‚Äî Global Warming Hoax Hit Hardest"
https://www.thegatewaypundit.com/2019/08/hockey-stick-broken-scientist-michael-mann-loses-in-court-forced-to-pay-court-costs-global-warming-hoax-hit-the-hardest/

by Jim Hoft August 25, 2019
Back in 2009, ‚ÄúClimategate‚Äù was a massive scandal with leaked documents revealing the climate change scam to be what it is, the Gateway Pundit reported on this scandal extensively when the story first broke.


Christopher Booker of the Telegraph back in 2009 slammed the climate alarmists behind the claims of global warming that was proving to be non-existent.

Dr. Michael Mann, the scientist that co-authored a famous graph of temperature trends known as the ‚Äúhockey stick graph‚Äù was implicated in the 2009 global warming email scandal, which the Gateway Pundit previously reported on.

This same Dr. Michael Mann, in 2012, sued the National Review and Competitive Enterprise Institute over their critique of his work regarding the climate change hoax. Mann even posted to his Facebook page about the lawsuit.
 
He featured a link to his attorney‚Äôs website just below the above opening statement.

In 2017, as The Gateway Pundit previously reported, Dr. Michael ‚ÄúHockey Stick‚Äù Mann committed contempt of court in what was dubbed the ‚Äúclimate science trial of the century‚Äù.
Dr. Mann defied the judge presiding over the case and refused to surrender his data for ‚Äúopen court examination‚Äù.  This is routine practice for scientific study to determine if the results will stand up against examination.  But Dr. Mann refused to turn over his data.

Principia Scientific noted the following:

    ‚ÄúOnly possible outcome: Mann‚Äôs humiliation, defeat and likely criminal investigation in the U.S.‚Äù

79-year-old Canadian climatologist Dr. Tim Ball is the defendant in the libel trial and told his attorneys to ‚Äútrigger mandatory punitive court sanctions, including a ruling that Mann did act with criminal intent when using public funds to commit climate data fraud‚Äù.

even back in 2017 scientists knew the defeat of Dr. Mann would only vindicate President Donald Trump in his claims that climate change is a hoax. The graph below from Principia Scientific shows ‚ÄúMann‚Äôs cherry-picked version of science [that] makes the Medieval Warm Period (MWP) disappear and shows a pronounced upward ‚Äôtick‚Äô in the late 20th century‚Äù ‚Äì this is the blade of Mann‚Äôs now infamous ‚Äúhockey stick‚Äù.

Below Mann‚Äôs graph is Ball‚Äôs, which uses much more reliable and easily attainable public data, which accurately shows a significantly warmer Medieval Warm Period with temperatures that are drastically hotter than the modern day‚Äôs.


Last week the court case against Dr. Tim Ball was decided by the Supreme Court of British Columbia, with Mann‚Äôs case thrown out, and him ordered to pay the defendant‚Äôs legal costs, no doubt a tidy sum of money.


This is a blow to junk scientists everywhere!

As reported by American Thinker ‚Äî  Technology News destroyed Michael Mann with their report on the case.

    Mann‚Äôs imminent defeat is set to send shock waves worldwide within the climate science community as the outcome will be both a legal and scientific vindication of U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs claims that climate scare stories are a ‚Äúhoax.‚Äù (snip)

    Michael Mann, who chose to file what many consider to be a cynical SLAPP (Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation) libel suit in the British Columbia Supreme Court, Vancouver six long years ago, has astonished legal experts by refusing to comply with the court direction to hand over all his disputed graph‚Äôs data. Mann‚Äôs iconic hockey stick has been relied upon by the UN‚Äôs IPCC and western governments as crucial evidence for the science of ‚Äòman-made global warming.‚Äô

He _Politicized_ and got heavily invested in an entire field of important scientific research, effectively destroying that field's credibility in the eye's of the general population. Get these damn politicians out of my science and make science legitimate again!

Comment:
It makes me sad to see some of these comments. 
I find it very strange that some people like pollution and actively working on trying to make the world worse. 
Do they not know they live on Earth? 
Have they not noticed the massive advancement in the sciences over the last hundred years?
What's to say the next big thing is not right around the corner. Throw enough money, time and energy at a problem, we can do amazing things.
Have a car that you plug in and charged by a solar panel, already possible and it's becoming cheaper quarterly. So that great.
Or some wind farm outside of town charging your batterys day and night. 
I personally like wave or tidal generation. 
I live on an island and the main road along the waterfront already gets swamped and large driftwood logs wind up on the highway. I live on the BC coast and we get some serious storms in the winter. 
This is happening, whether we like it or not. 
It will still be rich getting richer and not nearly enough jobs for the rest of us, but that is another conversation.
But we will at least get a better, and hopefully cheaper source of power. Hopefully sooner than later. I say we should do it.

Comment: AL GORE IS PART OF THE PROBLEM BECAUSE HE REFUSES TO MENTION OVERPOPULATION AS A FACTOR IN CLIMATE CHANGE. HE IS COMPLICIT IN THE CONSPIRACY OF SILENCE ON THIS IMPORTANT TOPIC. Al Gore is touring extensively to promote his new documentary, "An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth to Power." Last weekend, he appeared in person in Los Angeles on two consecutive nights at venues which screened his film and then conducted an interview with him afterward. Gore's message is all about clean energy and lowering emissions. He was a major player in the Paris Climate Agreement, which according to Pres. Trump was a one-sided deal "where the United States pays billions of dollars while China, Russia and India have contributed and will contribute nothing." (China & India hold the first and second spots for world's highest populations.) Not once during the film or interviews did Gore mention how the burgeoning human race was a huge contributor to every environmental problem on the planet, including the one he is most passionate about. The documentary was chock full of terrifying, dramatic video showing severe flooding throughout the world, including cities and countries that are currently overpopulated and growing (either through reproduction or immigration) at alarming rates, such as the Philippines, China, India & Pakistan, Houston, New Orleans, Miami, and New York City. Not once did he mention the devastating impact that overpopulation was having on these places, or that perhaps they should be required to lower their numbers in exchange for receiving tremendous sums of money to build a greener energy infrastucture. In "An Inconvenient Truth," Al Gore mentioned that, during his lifetime, the Earth's population had quadrupled. In this sequel, he quoted President George W. Bush as saying (paraphrase): "The growing population will require increasing amounts of energy to satisfy their needs." However, Gore never addressed that the "growing population" was something to halt, reverse, or even be concerned about. In addition, Gore's CLIMATE REALITY PROJECT has trained thousands of people to go out and spread the word. If these mini-Gores are hawking the same message, without addressing the scourge of overpopulation, then the biggest piece of the puzzle is being withheld and all proposed solutions will fall short. Gore: "The next generation would be justified in looking back at us and asking: What were you thinking? Couldn't you hear what the scientists were saying? Couldn't you hear what Mother Nature was screaming at you?" We want to know, what is Al Gore thinking? An experienced politician and educated environmentalist, how can his absolute refusal to illuminate the "people problem" be anything but intentional? Why is Al Gore so afraid of telling THAT inconvenient truth?

AGW alarmism is all just a bait and switch routine.  The only issue that matters is whether or not there is any genuine evidence that CO2 (which comprises 1/20th of 1% of the atmosphere, human contribution to which is only 3%) can/does cause the atmosphere to warm.  No science indicates such.  It's a plainly absurd premise. So alarmists simple refuse to discuss this issue.  And the only skeptics that make it through the media filter are the ones that have some irrelevancy and who would do anything to get some kind of publicity. An actual debate between a real scientist and an alarmist would be very short--and boring.  The scientist would ask for evidence that CO2 can/could/will cause warming.  The alarmist would evade the question and start talking about some irrelevancy, and the discussion would b over.  So this never happens because the media is mostly concerned about ratings and advertising dollars.  

Global warming (climate change) is really nothing but a science based religion. It‚Äôs an intellectual bait and switch scheme. If asked believers will supply you with a mountain of data. The data will do little more than vaguely suggest some alarming eventualities in the indeterminate future. If you then ask them to delineate the connection to carbon dioxide you can then expect to be called all kinds of derogatory names implying that you are self centered and don‚Äôt care about future generations. 

The revelation that global warming is a religion based loosely on science is hardly front page news. What is less well known is that the same can be said for aspects of meteorology, specifically the convection model of storm theory.

Title: An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth To Power (2017) - Official Trailer - Paramount Pictures
Comment:
I just saw this on a festival in Ostend, Belgium. Although I'm surely convinced by the scientific FACT that the earth is heating up (there should be no discussion on this what so ever or you are living in denial), the problem with this sequel is the focus is totally on the installation of more solar panels as a solution. Not once in this whole sequel our over consumption, nor our economic model, nor our diet habits, nor the continuing expansion of the population are questioned: all these factors however contribute to the problem of the greenhouse effect. 

An Inconvenient Sequel creates the complete illusion if people would only install more solar panels and windmills, we'll be alright. Also, it's rather a paradox you see Al Gore trying to making people more aware of environmental problems, while at the same time many of the shots are Al Gore sitting in a potent limousine.

Al Gore surely has done a huge part in making people more aware of the greenhouse effect, problem is: he refuses to question the American economic model (which is geared towards ever more production and consumption, hence more energy and resources needed). An Incovenient Sequel could have been a major opportunity for further educating the public, but it has become more of the Al Gore-show and less of in depth analysis of the problems at hand.

It's like arguing about if there is an ant infestation in the house, while the house is on fire!!! Yes, data shows that climate change is real, and if some people want to deny it, well, fine - but can we all agree that no matter what is true, pollution is real and it is making us, and our planet, sick. So if we work at cleaning the planet, if will be beneficial for everybody and everything: for our health, for our ressources (with recycling), for our economy (with new jobs) for the biodiversity, and it will help lower climate change (even if some people do not believe in it).

Comment:
"Does this movie explain why none of the apocalyptic predictions of the previous one have come true?"

Perhaps not.  But as someone who lived through the 1960s and 1970s I CAN tell you why the apocalyptic predictions that Northern forests would be destroyed by acid rain did not come true.  It was because political leaders took the warnings of scientists seriously and empowered the EPA (a creation of a Republican President) to force coal plants to employ scrubber technology and force car manufacturers to install catalytic converters.  Because our leaders took action, a crisis was averted. 
 
This is our 1970s, only the price of failure is much greater than the loss of some trees.  

It is time to stop prevaricating and instead take action.  To do otherwise is a moral failing of our generation.

Comment: Last year there were at least 60 peer-reviewed papers published in scientific journals demonstrating that *Today‚Äôs Warming Isn‚Äôt Global, Unprecedented, Or Remarkable.* Just within the last 5 months, 58 more papers and 80 new graphs have been published that continue to undermine the popularized conception of a slowly cooling Earth temperature history followed by a dramatic hockey-stick-shaped uptick, or an especially unusual global-scale warming during modern times. Yes, some regions of the Earth have been warming in recent decades or at some point in the last 100 years.  Some regions have been cooling for decades at a time.  And many regions have shown no significant net changes or trends in either direction relative to the last few hundred to thousands of years. Succinctly, then, scientists publishing in peer-reviewed journals have increasingly affirmed that there is nothing historically unprecedented or remarkable about today‚Äôs climate when viewed in the context of long-term natural variability.

Title: An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth To Power (2017) - Official Trailer - Paramount Pictures
Comment:
The inconvenient truth about "An Inconvenient Truth" is that it has more inconvenient falsehoods than truths. That, my friends, is an inconvenient fact. There is always room for discussion on humankind's impact on the environment, but Al Gore's arguments are spoiled by a huge degree of alarmism and exaggeration. Disagree with that if you will, but it is a fact that the majority of the predictions Mr. Gore made in his presentation have failed to come to pass. 

Don't think I am calling Mr. Gore an idiot. Far from it. Gore's wealth went from $700,000 in 2000 to an estimated net worth of  $172.5 million by 2015, thanks to his environmentalist activism. Gore and the former chief of Goldman Sachs Asset Management made nearly $218 million in profits between 2008 and 2011 from a carbon trading company they co-founded. By 2008, Gore was able to put a whopping $35 million into hedge funds and other investments. Don't you find it an inconvenient curiosity that Gore predicted a dramatic rise in ocean levels but used much of his newly earned wealth from green activism to purchase himself a beach front estate?

You do not need to be a climate science debunker to know a fraud when you see one. If you have serious concerns over the state of our environment, you could easily find a better, more accurate, and more truthful champion than Al Gore.

Title: An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth To Power (2017) - Official Trailer - Paramount Pictures
Comment:
Can I just remind climate change supporters that "ALL THESE SCIENTISTS AGREE WITH ME" isn't an argument - "appeal to authority" is a logical fallacy.
Instead you should arm yourself with facts and knowledge (that you can cite) to support your case. *Otherwise no discussion can be had, and you're not going to convince anybody!*
Personally I am not really on either side of the fence. I haven't really looked at the issue properly to know whether global warming is happening. And I don't know what the effects are either. I'm not going to trust people on the basis of "WELL EVERYBODY ELSE BELIEVES IN IT SO YOU SHOULD TOO" - as I say, appeal to authority is a logical fallacy. EVIDENCE is needed, and if you want to present some, then present it! Don't just say "it's out there"! As Christopher Hitchens said, "what can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence".
It may well be that the Earth's temperatures are rising, and that we are a significant contributing factor towards that. But, like ANY issue, we're not going to come to a consensus unless we consider all issues and all viewpoints!
What about people's jobs in industries that are "polluting"? You might say "for the greater good, they should give them up" - but do we know how quickly adverse effects of climate change on the Earth will take place? And more importantly, I think: what about all the other countries of the world? I looked at the Paris Climate Change Agreement, and there is nothing in there that can punish a country for not meeting its obligations. That means that China can still pursue its heavy industry, and make money offering products and services that Western countries have vowed not to produce, in the interests of being green, and therefore that they gain the economic rewards, while we do not.
I think there are valid points on both sides of this debate and you MUST consider both sides if you want to reach any sort of tangible, workable solutions. No matter which side you're on, if you shout at the other side saying "YOU'RE WRONG" you're not going to get anywhere - it's what religious factions have done for centuries, and they went to war with each other over their conflicting ideas!
You can either resolve a conflict by physical fighting, OR by verbal negotiation, and coming to a consensus that way. The best way to do this is to lay out your argument, and show your reasons for why you believe in your position. Then we can all examine what the reasoning is on both sides of the debate, and try and fit everybody's concerns into our solutions! If you don't do this then you are just inviting conflict at some further point in the future!

Title: An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth To Power (2017) - Official Trailer - Paramount Pictures
Comment:
I'd rather see a good, facts based, undramatic class on climate science made freely available here on youtube, than a movie where people who don't know that water vapor is the greenhouse gas with greatest effect in the atmosphere, cry on Al Gore's shoulder. 

I'd rather see people mass publicizing data on temperatures over the past 500k years, describing what measurement techniques were used to gather that data, their sources of error, and why that data can be trusted on its face in a time where activists have manipulated perceptions to lie about nuclear energy (for decades), when we have recently uncovered the truth about scientists who successfully perpetuated lies about sugar for almost 60 years, or when we know about the extremely well documented cases of those who were paid to lie about the effects of tobacco in the past. I think many people would be curious about the variables and processes that go into calcium carbonate analysis and other techniques, and might otherwise have reasonable doubts when the most obvious methods for measuring global temperatures with satellites couldn't possibly go back before 1958.

There should be a list that everyone knows by heart, of what the 10 biggest effects of global warming have already been, that are due to the now 250 year industrial era. We should all know who, where, and when people have been displaced by sea level rise. We should be able to explain why epochs of past warming have been a unilaterally good thing for humanity, why this one is different, and why the planet being as green as it has been in millions of years is also a red herring (I have no idea why this isn't a great thing).

Everyone should know what the growth metrics for technical progress in wind and solar are, and their environmental impact. People should know that wind mills have a huge mining cost in pollution and human life, people should contemplate the biodegradability of a solar panel. People should know that a mass of uranium the size of their computer has the same energy as burning a ton of gasoline a day for a million years.

If this is a scientific issue that effects all of humanity, there should at least be a corollary campaign pointing to an authoritative and reliable effort to increase scientific literacy on this subject. We can not be pessimistic about both the effects of climate change, and the ability of the public at large to become scientifically literate, if we are going to use science to build a political consensus. 

I imagine people will leave this movie knowing not a damn thing more than to be afraid, and how valuable will that be in a world where people don't trust each other?

Comment: Climate change and politics have always gone hand in hand in the US at least since 60s. Read the book "Merchants of Doubt" by Naomi Oreskes. It details how corporations, politically conservative scientists and political "think tanks" have tried to obscure the science around environmental issues. From acid raid, pesticides, the ozone layer to global warming. And they learned from the best: Big Tobacco. The plan is simple, try and give the public the impressions that there are two sides in the debate and that the matter is not settled yet. Publish counter claims in regular media (because scientific journals would reject them), cherry pick data and quotes, hire "experts" to appear on TV-interviews, set up blogs and YouTube-channels that spew empty counter-claims. Obfuscate, pervert and change the truth it until peoples heads spin. And it works, because global warming is a massively complex issues and the average Joe doesn't have the time nor the training to learn all of it, easier to listen to the pre-packaged bullshit that is being peddled by the deniers.

Comment: It is critical to pay attention to the science, and actual world events today.  I have been working on this issue for over 20 years, the early projections we made then have turned out to be too conservative.  Climate change is progressing more quickly than expected, or hoped.  Yes, the climate has changed before in response to changes in greenhouse gas concentrations.   These same gases, including carbon and methane, are increasing in our atmosphere at an unprecedented rate due to our use of fossil fuels.  Our fossil fuel use includes oil consumption in our cars and trucks, coal and natural gas use by our power plants and industrial facilities.  Fossil fuel is likely powering the data center enabling this post.  Insulting the messenger won't change this fact.  Better to join forces to slow the crisis...and not leave all the work to our kids.  They deserve more from us.
